thread.title: GOP's Rubio seeks aggressive approach to Russia

title: GOP's Rubio seeks aggressive approach to Russia
text:

Republican presidential candidate Sen. Marco Rubio, R-Fla., speaks during a town hall meeting, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Cedar Falls, Iowa. Photo: Charlie Neibergall, AP Republican presidential candidate Sen. Marco Rubio, R-Fla., speaks... Image 2 of 3 
Republican presidential candidate Sen. Marco Rubio, R-Fla., signs autographs following a town hall meeting, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Cedar Falls, Iowa. Photo: Charlie Neibergall, AP Republican presidential candidate Sen. Marco Rubio, R-Fla., signs... Image 3 of 3 
Audience members listen as Republican presidential candidate Sen. Marco Rubio, R-Fla., speaks during a town hall meeting, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Cedar Falls, Iowa. Photo: Charlie Neibergall, AP Audience members listen as Republican presidential candidate Sen.... GOP's Rubio seeks aggressive approach to Russia 1 / 3 Back to Gallery CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa (AP) â€” Republican presidential contender Marco Rubio is calling for a more aggressive approach to Russia, including new sanctions against major officials and companies. The Florida senator calls Russian President Vladimir Putin a "gangster and a thug." In Iowa on Friday, Rubio said if he's elected, he'll seek additional visa bans, provide more assistance to Ukraine and limit diplomatic engagement with Moscow "on issues not essential to resolving the crisis in Ukraine." Rubio says the U.S. is "barreling toward a second Cold War." Russia began airstrikes in Syria this week. While Moscow officials maintain that they are targeting Islamic State groups and other extremists, U.S. authorities have questioned that, noting the areas hit were strongholds of rebels seeking to oust President Bashar Assad .
